website_summaries.verdict: This model has double run time batteries to give you extra time at work between charges.
pros: Converts from trimmer to edger to mini-mower
Telescoping shaft makes it easy to make height adjustments for user
Batteries are compatible with other WORX 20V power tools
cons: Line feed is not as good as promised

customer_reviews.title: This model has power and can certainly cut!
customer_reviews.text: I have used a Worx trimmer for 6 years and my battery finally wouldn't hold a charge anymore. Upgraded to the Hi Capacity Worx WG 160.4 4 AH GT 2.0 model and I am SO pleased with the performance! Would recommend this to anyone wanting a lightweight trimmer that does the job. I have back issues and love that I can work in my yard with no bad effects! Hope this one holds up as well as my old one!
customer_reviews.author: Lynette

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Weed-Wacker:  Good Battery Life and Didn't Need to Let Out Line All the Time
customer_reviews.text: This is my first nonelectric weed-wacker, so I didn't have any expectations going in. Having said that, I am pleasantly surprised at how powerful it is and how long the battery life is. I have a big yard with lots of things with borders (trees, flower bed, etc.) and needed move between them over a fair amount of distance. The battery wasn't close to running out, and the line lasted a long time. I wasn't constantly having to let out more. I would recommend. A-
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first cordless weed whacker. It works great. I have yet to run out the battery and I even bought an extra because I didn't expect it to last long enough to do all I needed to do. More than enough power. It even cut through very thick stemmed weeds like that of a thistle plant. Love that you can change the handle position easily. The wheels that you can attach didn't work like I expected but it's so lightweight, I could easily hold and swing it about. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Phobos

customer_reviews.title: Both Edger and Trimmer Work Well
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for light-duty occasional use. I use it for edging and touch-up mowing the lawn care people miss. I recharge the battery after each use so it's always ready to use when I need it. Collapses into a smaller size for storage. Line lasts forever.
customer_reviews.author: Kailua Steve

customer_reviews.title: More powerful that the 18 volt model
customer_reviews.text: Good balance, good power for taller grass, still has a problem with auto line feed like my old one. Have to turn it over and hand feed out the cutting line a lot. Update: The 2 batteries with this Worx trimmer have far superior run time than my old GT batteries. Used to go through 3 batteries to trim my whole yard, now one does almost my whole yard!
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: Happy Happy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, charge, put battery in and pull the handle. Light weight easy to use. I got 2 batteries for mine but 1 did more then 3\4 of my very badly overgrown yard. So I am impressed. No more hard to start, smelly gas job for me. No more mixing gas and oil. Thank you WORX for something that does work!
customer_reviews.author: Kittalla

customer_reviews.title: Great for homeowners
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this trimmer. It is very light, almost to the point of feeling “cheap”, but it is by design. My only complaint is manually push the button to feed the line, but, in the long run more reliable than bashing it on the ground. It is not for heavy usage, but great for a homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K. Kilgore

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this at this price point
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing quality of plastic parts and self feeding string does not. You must stop every 15-20 seconds and manually pull it out. I would not recommend this at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo456

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again .
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use. Quiet and rugged. Battery charges quickly. Plenty of power for grass trimming. 4 a 20 volt battery runs exceptionally well.
customer_reviews.author: DOWANA CARR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use! Starts up with a push button, lightweight, wheels and snap on spool for line change. Wish I had bought this sooner - my gas powered one was real pain to use compared to this.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfpax

customer_reviews.title: Good little tool
customer_reviews.text: Great ''little tool'' this is not a replacement for your weed wacker that you use for clearing . Easy to use. Good for people who are not physically strong enough to hold up other trimmers.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Great lawnmower replacement  ... for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Better than the version I've owned and used for 5 years. Very small grass area surrounding my house. This works just fine, and am pleased that I do not need a lawnmower anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Vintagemusic

customer_reviews.title: Battery Charger Issues
customer_reviews.text: Worx WG160.4 4AH GT 2.0 Hi-Capacity The battery pack does not show green for charged or red for not charged. The battery pack is extremely difficult to take off the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Dahlstrom

customer_reviews.title: working item
customer_reviews.text: Could not get this item to start even to the charged batteries. returned
customer_reviews.author: Elaina

customer_reviews.title: Saved a lot of money
customer_reviews.text: We used this for our Ford Escape to hold up the rear hatchback. Would have been over $100 to have the work done. They installed easily and work well. Our only suggestion is to use better packaging and enclose instructions!
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Batteries last long
customer_reviews.text: I was totally surprised that the small spoils of line last very long. Best for grass trimming not made for large thick weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S.

customer_reviews.title: Best product ever
customer_reviews.text: Best product ever. Easy to use, easy to change out the spools, and I ordered the extra battery so I always have one on hand. Lightweight and easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: Wow I am amazed with this. It is very useful and easy to handle. Thanks guys...
customer_reviews.author: Ketan

customer_reviews.title: Shield hard to attach
customer_reviews.text: Heavy for me. Didn't like that I had to screw in the orange shield. It was hard to attached to the top wand.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: The BEST!
customer_reviews.text: Love this weed eater, as much as one can love a yard tool. Could be a little stronger made, had to replace a part that broke, but other than that it is the best I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L. Mattox

customer_reviews.title: love the fact that it's lightweight for females to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected and more, love the fact that it's lightweight for females to use and I'm excited to try other products in the Worx line.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The electric motor melted a post on the motor and is now not working condition
customer_reviews.text: Light enough battery life good spools of replacement string small but easy to switch it out.
customer_reviews.author: Andy M

customer_reviews.title: wheels
customer_reviews.text: great machine, junk line better after I started with ding my on line on the spools myself, still looking for even better line ,wheels are why I bought it they are great, line that came with it are junk!!!
customer_reviews.author: lamar haun

customer_reviews.title: It is ok for light jobs.
customer_reviews.text: It is not as sturdy as it looks. It ok for light jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery powered weed eater... great equipment!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this weed eater!! Very easy to use, light weight, and battery lasts about 45 minutes before needing a recharge
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Jacoby

customer_reviews.title: Battery lasts 30 to 45 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Works around the house fine. But when working around trees or fence the maneuvering is not as easy.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: very easy to use and happy it came with two batteries. Solid product so far!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its okay. I'm not sure about the auto feed ...
customer_reviews.text: Its okay. I'm not sure about the auto feed of the trimming line.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Gaglio

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely useless.
customer_reviews.text: This item is absolutely worthless and I would rather use my house scissors to trim. I would not keep it even if it was free of charge. I'm so irritated that I don't even feel like cleaning off the little grass on it for the return.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Angelo

customer_reviews.title: light weight
customer_reviews.text: I have found this easy to use. I have edged my lawn a couple of times and it has worked well. A couple of times it has taken a moment or tow to click it into the right position but once there it has been fine. The battery life seems to do well and it does come with two batteries. Overall this is not too heavy and personally, I prefer it to a gas powered one. It has done well taking down long grass and trimming the edges around our basketball hoop and tall grass along the walls. I would recommend this product overall. It was also relatively easy to use straight out of the box
customer_reviews.author: L.K.N.S

customer_reviews.title: New stronger sibling
customer_reviews.text: We had a WORX trimmer three years ago, and it did good service around the house and pet yard. This is obviously an upgrade to our older version, and that is all to the good. The price has increased, but this one has two lithium batteries wherein lies a chunk of change. The batteries are more powerful, too. Between the two, one can easily weedeat and trim as long as one wants to, on a modest property. As I mentioned, this is our second WORX product, and we will not hesitate to acquire other tools by the same company.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great Weed Eater!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this weed eater. It was very easy to get ready to use. At first, I was a little dissapointed by its weight. It seemed heavy for an electric weed eater, but that's the trade off for not having to drag around an extension cord. The rechargeable batteries last about 3 trimmings on my average lawn. Plus, there are two batteries, so I keep one charged and ready while I use the other. This is a win!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, bad instructions
customer_reviews.text: The Edger/Mini-Mower works well but the assembly instructions are worse than useless. It is a series of illustrations that are too small to be seen clearly. There was no text and the drawings did little to illustrate the actions I was supposed to make. I finally managed to figure it out by myself and once I did it worked very well. The inclusion of two batteries allowed me ample time to trim my yard.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Mathews

customer_reviews.title: It's light and easy to maneuver and it's battery operated - no more ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this weed whacker! It's light and easy to maneuver and it's battery operated - no more 100ft cords to reach the necessary areas that must be trimmed. And to top it off, the second battery is a bonus - we have quite a lot of driveway and area to trim so using two batteries is what we require. The real test will come in the Spring - I'll be back!
customer_reviews.author: S. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Ready and able for those early Spring chores
customer_reviews.text: This is a delightfully lightweight trimmer, one that can indee be used by either the man or the lady of the house. It is a good habit to recharge this after every use so that it's ready and able for the next trimming task. The Spring season is nearly upon us and so this is maybe not an absolute necessity. However, it is one that you should have around for Spring chores.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life
customer_reviews.text: This weed cutter had a long battery life. Feeding the line could be improved, I would not exactly call it automatic. The handle makes the chore a little easier. Torque is good for an electric, not as strong as a gas. Overall it is a pretty good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far, but time will tell
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far, great power, dont miss my gas powered Worx yet, but time will tell if the lithium ion is sufficent for a full days work
customer_reviews.author: LovesAmazon

product_meta.title: WORX WG160.4 4AH 2.0 Hi-Capacity GT
product_meta.description: The WORX gt 2.0 hi-capacity 4.0 ah is the upgraded version of our most popular tool - a powerful string trimmer, a precision edger & even a mini-mower, all in one lightweight, cordless Machine. Hi-capacity 4.0 ah batteries deliver double the run time of our regular Gt2.0, along with faster charging time. Includes 2 20V 4.0 ah batteries + charger.
feature_bullets: Enjoy double the run time thanks to the new hi capacity 4.0 Ah batteries (2 batteries included)
Convert trimmer easily to an edger or mini mower in seconds
Telescopic shaft adjusts to user's Height and posture and adjustable handle for maximum comfort and control
100 percent automatic single line feed for Best cutting performance
Share batteries across all your 20V power share WORX tools so you never run out of power

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars66 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
